definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: to remain behind, delay, tarry (Ar. 0’ax=ara to put off, also to remain behind; Aram. Pa. [[אֵחַר]], Aph. 0awh.ar, Shaph. 4awoh.ar, Sab. [[אחַר]] Osiander:ZMG 1865, 197; [[אחַחַר]] DHM:Epigr. Denkm. 34). †

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: once only Ge 32:5 [[וׇאֵחַר]] (contr. fr. [[וׇאֶאֱחַר]] cf. [[אֵהָָב]] Pr 8:17)  and I have tarried until now. †

intensive, delay, tarry, abs. Ju Jdg 5:28 (‖[[בּשֵׁשׁ לָבוֹא]]) Is 46:13 and my salvation [[לאׁ תִאַחֵר]] Hb Hab 2:3, Ps 40:18 = Ps 70:5, Da 9:19; with [[ל]] & inf. Ge 34:19.—Pr 23:30 [[מְאַחֲרִים עַל־הַיׇּיִ֑ן]]  those tarrying over the wine, Is 5:11 [[מְאַחֲרֵי בַנֶּשֶׁף]], Ps 127:2 [[מְאַחֲרֵי שֶׁבֶת]] (‖[[מַשְׁכִּימֵי קוּם]]).

causat. of Qal, cause one to delay, hinder Ge 24:56; keep back(= bring late) Ex 22:28; with [[ל]] & inf. delay to… De 23:22 quoted Ec 5:3: ellipt. De 7:10 he delayeth (it, the recompense) not to his enemy.—2Sa 20:5 Qr [[וַיּ֫וֹחֶר]] is taken by Ol:§ 241 c as Qal (cf. [[וַתּׂ֫חֶז]] v:2Sa 20:9 from [[אָחַז]]), by Sta:§ 498 c Kö:1. 397 Ges:§ 68 2 Rem as Hiph. (lit. shewed, exhibited delay): on the Kt (? [[וַיֵּיחַר]]) v. Dr:Sm.
